title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for describing a reason why pilgrims visit the sacred sites in either Image 1 or Image 2.

Two points for describing two separate reasons why pilgrims visit sacred sites by referencing either Image 1 or Image 2.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following reasons why pilgrims visit sacred sites:
The response correctly describes one of the following reasons why pilgrims visit sacred sites:
The response correctly describes two of the following reasons why pilgrims visit sacred sites:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that Buddhism moved to different locations from its hearth through relocation diffusion.

Two points for explaining how and where Buddhism spread as a result of relocation diffusion.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that the spread of Buddhism from its culture hearth is an example of relocation diffusion:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that the spread of Buddhism from its culture hearth is an example of relocation diffusion:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that the spread of Buddhism from its culture hearth is an example of relocation diffusion:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating the global spatial pattern difference between Judaism and Islam.

Two points for explaining how the global spatial pattern differs between Judaism and Islam.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that the global spatial pattern of Judaism differs from the global spatial pattern of universalizing religions such as Islam:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that the global spatial pattern of Judaism differs from the global spatial pattern of universalizing religions such as Islam:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating an economic effect of migration patterns in Image 1.

Two points for explaining how patterns of migration can impact the economy in Image 1.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that diversity may result in different religions.

Two points for explaining how religion contributes to diversity within a multinational state shown in Image 2.
